remarks: A lattice automorphism argument is equal to its value if all atoms are equal to their values.  (Contributed by NM, 24-May-2012.)
statement:
lauteq.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
lauteq.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
lauteq.i $e |- I = ( LAut ` K ) $.
lauteq $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ F e. I /\ X e. B ) /\ A. p e. A ( F ` p ) = p ) -> ( F ` X ) = X ) $.
$d A p $.
$d B p $.
$d F p $.
$d I p $.
$d K p $.
$d X p $.
